instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
Have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> thats water damaged, has a green light no fan spin.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.3v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> 12.3v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V</SIGNAL> 12.3
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3</SIGNAL> 12.3
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> 16.8v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 16.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42v 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_TX_L</SIGNAL> = 0v

someone worked on this board before and from what i can tell <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> have been replaced or reballed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: PPBUS on 12.3V is not ok, check resistance on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> between pins 17/18 and 27/28, voltage on pin 10 and 11.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: So someone messed with the ISL probably because they were hoping for a easy one and not a dead SMC. Check if pins 10 and 11 of the isl are shorted. If so, it's going to be either the ISL, SMC or <DIODE>D6950</DIODE> (May have got the number wrong, use brain to figure out which one I mean that pins 10 and 11 of the ISL lead to ;) ) If they are not shorted, Try a new ISL. If it still doesnt work, Take the edge bonding off the SMC and give it a reflow with flux and some heat. See if it works and go from there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 37765"]PPBUS on 12.3V is not ok, check resistance on <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> between pins 17/18 and 27/28, voltage on pin 10 and 11.....[/QUOTE]

resistance between pin 17/18 is 4.1ohms and between 27/28 is 20.6ohms and pins 10 and 11 have 3.42v

threads.message: Try new ISL

threads.message: swapped it twice

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: There must be a broken trace then somewhere on the data lines. I had one the other day where the trace between the SMC and the pullup resistor was broken. Also possible one of the pullups is bad or blown

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: super green here lol, so pullup resistor for this board is <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Check <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> as well as the traces between them and the SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Both 3.42V and traces look fine...scratched the top of the trace right before it gets to SMC and is also 3.42 on both

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Might be a dumb question, but are you measuring with just the board and no battery? If so, the only thing I can think is the SMC you put on is bad.

threads.message: Yes board+magsafe only. Ill try another SMC right now

threads.message:
Nope, just needed to know you weren't using "new" SMCs.

Is charger light turning orange? Is <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present?

Got a scope?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Typically when PPBUS is low like that the SMBUS data lines cause it which a lot of the times is the SMC pulling it down. In your case, it's a weird one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: If I pull the SMC off again and Diode Mode each pin and post here would that help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: You have to use the same SMC from the same board number!!!! No wonder it doesnt work!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: SMC is not running at all as <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is also missing now. In previous post you said <SIGNAL>G2_EN</SIGNAL> was present so at that point the SMC was running so something has been messed up or your recalling is no good. Check for knocked off components around SMC and check your recalling method. This is certainly a problem in the SMC area.
